title: Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Bar", May 20, 1934
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Architect's stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY; see inscription
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at lower left: NOTE! EXT. BAR ON WHEELS & METAL EXT. SLIDES/CABINET FASTENDED TO FLOOR & WALL. Inscribed in graphite at lower left: SIDE ELEV. Inscribed in graphite at lower center: FRONT ELEV. Inscribed in graphite at lower left: 9. Inscribed dimensions, instructions, materials. Inscribed in graphite in architect's stamp: 7904; 1"-1'-0"; RAND; Olsson / 5/20/34; 5/21/34 1 S.H.K.
description: Plans and elevation drawings for bar/cabinet for George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand apartment. Bar in L-shape; shorter side has curved sides, longer side is rectangular. Sofa against inner section of L-shape, with recessed shelf to right of sofa. At outside corner on shorter side is door that pulls out to reveal the bar. Glasses on top shelf of bar in trays, bottles on lower shelf, and ice container in left corner of lower shelf. Top of concealed bar and top of outer structure is Bakelite, sides of outer edge are cork with brushed chrome outline. Additional cabinet space to left of concealed bar.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Bar", May 20, 1934.
May 20, 1934. Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1988-101-15.
